data.title: Death of Kathleen Massey
data.meta_description: Kathleen Massey, 65, of Gillespie, died in Alton, on Wednesday, February 21, 2024, at 3:32 pm. She was born June 9, 1958, to Homer Hunter and Sophia
data.text:
Kathleen Massey, 65, of Gillespie, died in Alton, on Wednesday, February 21, 2024, at 3:32 pm. She was born June 9, 1958, to Homer Hunter and Sophia Foster. She married Les Massey on November 17, 1978, in Belleville.

She was a homemaker.

She is survived by her spouse, Les Massey of Gillespie, daughter, Jennifer (Michael) Brown of Alton, stepdaughter, Stella Massey of Brighton, grandchildren, Erika, Kaiden, Paislee, Allie, Christopher, Cierra, Jason, Madison, Joseph, Lena, Lyle, Ryea, Nyki, Matt, great-grandchildren, Bryson, Amelia, Xander, siblings, Earlene (Scott) Johnson, David (Thelma) Hunter, Frank Hunter, Roger (Sue) Hunter. Kathleen was preceded in death by her parents, daughter, Stacie Massey, and stepson, James Massey.

Friends may call on Wednesday, February 28, 2024, at Kravanya Funeral Home in Gillespie, from 2:00 pm until 4:00 pm. Funeral services are Wednesday, February 28, 2024, at 4:00 pm at Kravanya Funeral Home in Gillespie.

Memorials are suggested to donor’s choice. Anyone wishing to send an online condolence may do so at www.kravanyafuneral.com. Kravanya Funeral Home, Gillespie, is in charge of the arrangements.

Sharon Hartman, 88 of rural Staunton, passed away at 8:56 AM on Friday, August 23, 2024, at the Villas of Holly Brook in East Alton. She was born on November 4, 1935, in Belvidere, IL, the daughter of the late Mark and Helen (Thorton) Thayer. She married Dewey D. “Joe” Hartman on February 2, 1957, in Belvidere and he passed away on August 27, 2023.

Sharon was a homemaker who loved to cook and entertain, hosting large groups for meals and family get-togethers. She faithfully attended the Community Christian Church in Alton and loved spending time with her children, grandchildren, great-grandchildren, and 27 foster kids. She also enjoyed gardening.

She is survived by five children, Donna Jo (Buddy) Daniel of Crainhill, AL, Danny William Hartman of Cleveland, TN, Dori (Kenny) Rhodes of Staunton, Lee (Terry) Hancock of Litchfield, and Bagi (Mina) Byambajov of Mongolia; 11 grandchildren, Autumn (Conner) Hearn, Brooke Wacker, Lucas Munds (Renee), Kyle Jon Hartman (Mara), Graham Christopher Hartman, Ben (Esther) Rhodes, Phil (Nicole) Rhodes, Jake (Mia) Rhodes, Josh (Brandi) Rabida, Cassie (Shawn) Royer, and Joe Byambajov; 17 great-grandchildren; two sisters, Susan (Mike) Hohm of Rockford and Penny Grooms of Belvidere; one brother, Steven (Anita) Abernathy of Caledonia, IL; and several nieces and nephews.

Besides her husband and parents, she was preceded in death by three brothers, Jimmy Thayer, Reggie Abernathy, and Tommy Abernathy; one sister, Bonnie Hartman; and one daughter-in-law, Delisa Hartman.

Visitation will be held Saturday, August 31, 2024, from 11 AM to 1 PM at Williamson Funeral Home in Staunton. Funeral services will follow on Saturday, August 31, 2024, at 1 PM at Williamson Funeral Home in Staunton with Pastor David Burger officiating.

Memorials are suggested to either Community Christian Church of Alton, Youth with a Mission (YWAM), or to While We Wait Foster Care (not for profit).

Robert Duncan Fulton, 81 of Gillespie, died at his residence on Thursday, August 22, 2024, at 9:36 a.m. He was born on October 4, 1942, in Chicago to Robert Davies Fulton and Geraldine Louise Duncan Fulton.

He married Patricia Ann Crouser Fulton on February 20, 1965, in Gillespie. He was retired after having been a high school principal for Community Unit School District 7. Robert enjoyed the St. Louis Cardinals, Fighting Illini, auto racing, fishing, mowing grass, and his dog, Coal.

He is survived by his spouse, Patty Fulton of Gillespie; children, Robert “Bob” (Lucinda) Fulton of Staunton and Suzanne (Baron) Stayton of Carlinville; grandchildren, Miranda (Chandler) Coulter, Lydia Fulton, Samantha Fulton, Megan Stayton (Patrick Kilian), Drew (Breanne) Stayton, and Jillian Stayton; and brother, Glenn (Renée) Fulton of Moro, IL.

Robert was preceded in death by his parents.

A memorial visitation will be held on Monday, August 26, 2024, at Kravanya Funeral Home in Gillespie from 5:00 until 8:00 p.m. Memorials are suggested to Partnership For Educational Excellence District #7 or Siteman Cancer Center.

Kravanya Funeral Home, Gillespie is in charge of the arrangements.

Share this story

comments

Violet M. Ziglar, 97 of Staunton, passed away at 3:05 PM on Monday, August 19, 2024, at Community Hospital of Staunton. She was born on October 22, 1926, in Staunton, the daughter of the late Joseph and Ricca (Odorizzi) Fortuna.

She married Edward J. Ziglar on June 28, 1947, he passed away on January 15, 1999. Vi was primarily a homemaker but worked for a time as a clerk at Hefer’s Grocery Store in Staunton. She was also a member of St. Michael Catholic Church of Staunton.

She was a vibrant presence at the Staunton Country Club where her love for golf and swimming was only surpassed by the friendships she formed. Word has it she achieved the elusive hole-in-one, but verifying this is challenging as many of her friends have already passed through the gates of Heaven. Her smile was contagious and she brought energy and joy to everyone around her. In her younger years, she was passionate about quilting and creating beautiful ceramics, leaving behind a legacy of both art, and warmth.

Her grandchildren were her pride and joy and she showered them with boundless love, cooking, and wisdom. The memories she created with them will be cherished forever; a treasure trove of worth and happiness that will continue to inspire them throughout their lives.

Though she is no longer with us, the stories, lessons, and love remain. She was an amazing person and fought hard until God called her to His glorious home.

Violet is survived by her three children, E. Steven (Bev Hartman) Ziglar, Larry (Virginia) Ziglar, and Susan DeLaurent; four grandchildren, Tracy Morrison, Nicole (Todd) Bailey, Tim (Charlie) Sievers, and Kati (Greg) Harkins; eight great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews.

Besides her husband and parents, she was preceded in death by her brother, Dominic (Floriene) Fortuna, and her sister, Delores (Leroy) Hart.

Private services will be held at a later date. Memorials are suggested to the Staunton Country Club or to any Staunton charity. Williamson Funeral Home is in charge of arrangements.
